text:
DATO' SRI TAHIR:
During Suharto times,

you can see the mentality of
the conglomerate of businessmen.
It's like this.

Between the
businessmen, if I want

to prove that I'm
stronger than you,

then I will tell you how many
ministers, how many general,

how many influence people in
behind of me who picked me up.

So then they borrow the money
from the State Bank unlimited,
no limit.

When they make business, they
don't have a proper any plan.
What is the debt equity ratio?

What is the sound proper
financial structure?
They don't care.

If they set up the factory,
they bought machinery
from Japan or Germany or Europe.

And then, they borrow
money, maybe 100%.

There's not any
debt equity ratio.

Or they will borrow
money, maybe 150% more
than the project itself.

So the consequences in
the accounting that you go

to the cost of goods sold
in the interest payment

and depreciation, and then
you cannot sell the goods.

Then, you ask for
government favor.

Why don't you do protection
by increasing the high tariff,

or by issuing a regulation
that this product is monopoly?

Then, it is called
high-cost economy.

Then, you bear all the
expenses to the consumers.

That's why one of the factors
make Suharto economic collapse.
That's one of the main factors.
This, I think--

I'm talking corruption
is not just bribing.

I'm talking corruption
is the system.
It's not healthy.
